file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 53-01-02-04 - PASSENGER-CABIN FLOOR PANELS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL PASSENGER-CABIN FLOOR PANELS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the Passenger-Cabin Floor Panels. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) PASSENGER-CABIN FLOOR PANELS - 53-01-02-000-802-A EMB-135 REMOVAL ACFT MODEL(S) PASSENGER-CABIN FLOOR PANELS - 53-01-02-400-802-A EMB-135 INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 53-01-02 Page 1 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-01-02-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 2. PASSENGER-CABIN FLOOR PANELS - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the instructions to remove the Passenger-Cabin Floor Panels. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 25-21-01-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-21-02-000-801-A/400 FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-21-03-000-801-A/400 OPTIONAL FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-24-01-000-801-A/400 PASSENGER-CABIN FLOOR LINING - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-26-02-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-803-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-804-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-27-03-000-801-A/400 TOILET PARTITION - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-27-08-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-30-01-000-804-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-30-05-000-802-A/400 OUTBOARD GALLEY - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-30-07-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-40-01-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 33-50-12-000-801-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 130 Fuselage center section I 140 Fuselage center section II 150 Fuselage center section III 160 Fuselage center section IV D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the screws available EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 53-01-02 Page 2 of 14 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-PRF-680, TYPE I Solvent or equivalent AR TT-I-735 Isopropyl alcohol AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-015-A (1) Remove the Passenger Seats (AMM TASK 25-21-01-000-801-A/400) to remove floor panels 241AF, 241EF, 251AF, 251JF, 251KF, 251EF, 251GF, 251JF, and 261CF on the LH side, 242AF, 242BF, 252AF, 252BF, 252CF, 252DF, and 262BF on the RH side, and, if applicable, 231EF and 231HF on the LH side. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (2) Remove the Optional Flight Attendant Seat ( AMM TASK 25-21-03-000-801-A/400) to remove floor panel 262BF. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (3) Remove the Toilet Partition ( AMM TASK 25-27-03-000-801-A/400) to remove floor panel 262CF. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (4) Remove the Lavatory (AMM TASK 25-40-01-000-801-A/400) to remove floor panels 262CF and 261DF. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (5) Remove the Floor Proximity Strip Lights (AMM TASK 33-50-12-000-801-A/400) to remove floor panels 231GF, 241BF, 241DF, 251DF, 251FF, and 251HF. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (6) Remove the LH Wardrobe Option 2 (AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-804-A/400) to remove floor panels 231EF and 231HF, if applicable. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (7) Remove the LH Wardrobe Option 1 (AMM TASK 25-26-04-000-803-A/400) to remove floor panel 231EF, if applicable. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 53-01-02 Page 3 of 14 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (8) Remove the LH Galley (AMM TASK 25-30-07-000-801-A/400) to remove floor panel 231EF, if applicable. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (9) For aircraft with Airstairs Door, remove the Flight Attendant Seat ( AMM TASK 25-21-02-000-801-A/400) to remove floor panels 231CF and 231BF. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (10) For aircraft with Side-Hinged Main Door, remove the Flight Attendant Seat ( AMM TASK 25-21-02-000-801-A/400) to remove floor panels 231JF and 231BF. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (11) Remove the RH Wardrobe (AMM TASK 25-26-02-000-801-A/400) or the Outboard Galley Assembly ( AMM TASK 25-30-05-000-802-A/400), as applicable, to remove floor panel 232AF. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (12) Remove the Forward Galley (AMM TASK 25-30-01-000-804-A/400) to remove floor panel 232BF. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (13) Remove the RH Windscreen (AMM TASK 25-27-08-000-801-A/400) to remove floor panel 232CF. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (14) Remove the Passenger-Cabin Floor Lining ( AMM TASK 25-24-01-000-801-A/400) to remove all passenger-cabin floor panels. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. J. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) (Figure 403) SUBTASK 020-015-A (1) Remove the white adhesive tapes and discard them. For aircraft with Airstairs Door, refer to Figure 402. For aircraft with Side-Hinged Main Door, refer to Figure 403. (2) Remove the screws (1) that attach the floor panel (2) to the passenger-cabin floor beams. (3) Remove the floor panel (2). (4) Examine the polyethylene tape on floor panels for general condition. If it is necessary, replace the tape with a new one. (a) Discard the old polyethylene tape. WARNING: MIL-PRF-680 TYPE I SOLVENT IS CLASSIFIED AS A FLAMMABLE PRODUCT, DO NOT USE IN TEMPERATURES ABOVE 38ÃÂ°C (100ÃÂ°F). ASSURE PROPER VENTILATION TO USE IN ANY AIRCRAFT AREA. (5) With a cloth soaked in solvent, clean the surface butt straps of floor structure for remove the old CIC. WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING WHEN YOU HANDLE THEM. DO NOT BREATHE THEIR GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (6) With a clean cloth soaked in Isopropyl alcohol, clean all floor panels where the work will be done. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 53-01-02 Page 4 of 14 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

SCREW DET. B 2. FLOOR PANEL DET. C 1 TORQUE: 1.8-2.9 N.m (16-26 lb.in) 2 THE SCREWS MUST BE WET WITH COR-BAN 27L. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-01-02-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 3. PASSENGER-CABIN FLOOR PANELS - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the instructions to install the Passenger-Cabin Floor Panels. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION 53-01-00 - AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 25-21-01-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-21-02-400-801-A/400 FLIGHT ATTENDANT SEAT - INSTALLATION PASSENGER-CABIN FLOOR LINING - INSTALLA- AMM TASK 25-24-01-400-801-A/400 TION AMM TASK 25-26-02-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-04-400-803-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-26-04-400-804-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-27-03-400-801-A/400 TOILET PARTITION - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 25-27-08-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-30-01-400-804-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-30-05-400-802-A/400 OUTBOARD GALLEY - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 25-30-07-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-40-01-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - AMM TASK 33-50-12-400-801-A/400 - CPM 51-61-00 - IPC 53-01-02 PASSENGER CABIN FLOOR C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 130 Fuselage center section I 140 Fuselage center section II 150 Fuselage center section III 160 Fuselage center section IV D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the screws available EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 53-01-02 Page 10 of 14 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (Continued) ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Acrylic spatula To install polyurethane film available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MEP 09-075 Corrosion-Inhibiting Compound (COR-BAN 27L) AR MEP 10-063 Corrosion-Inhibiting Compound (Dinitrol AV-30) AR TT-I-735 Isopropyl alcohol AR MIL-PRF-680, TYPE I Solvent or equivalent AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) White adhesive tape IPC 53-01-02 AR PI335 Preto AE-AA3x20MM (Black foam shape) IPC 53-01-02 AR Strip-N-Stick 200A (Black foam shape) IPC 53-01-02 AR 5421-100 mm (Polyethylene Tape) IPC 53-01-02 AR Floor Panel 53-01-00 AR H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the passenger cabin I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) (Figure 403) (Figure 404) SUBTASK 420-015-A (1) Examine the polyethylene tape on the butt straps on floor structure at the Galley and Toilet areas for general conditions. If it is necessary to replace the polyethylene tape, do this step: (a) Apply Dinitrol AV-30 and the new polyethylene tape on the butt straps of floor structure in the Galley and Toilet areas according to CPM 51-61-00. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 53-01-02 Page 11 of 14 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Examine the black foam shape on the floor panels edges at the Galley and Toilet areas for general conditions. If it is damaged refer to (Figure 404) and do the steps below: (a) Cut the damaged portion of the black foam shape (3 x 20 mm) and discard it. NOTE: Make sure that the polyethylene tape is not damaged. WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING WHEN YOU HANDLE THEM. DO NOT BREATHE THEIR GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (b) With a clean cloth soaked in Isopropyl alcohol, clean all floor panels where the work will be done. (c) Install a new portion of the black foam shape (3 x 20 mm). (3) Examine the polyethylene tape on the floor panels edges at the Galley and Toilet areas for general conditions. If it is damaged refer to (Figure 404) and do these steps: (a) Discard the old polyethylene tape and the black foam shape (3 x 20 mm). WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING WHEN YOU HANDLE THEM. DO NOT BREATHE THEIR GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (b) With a clean cloth soaked in Isopropyl alcohol, clean all floor panels where the work will be done. (c) Apply the new polyethylene tape and, with aid of an acrylic spatula, remove the bubbles. NOTE: Protect with the same tape the bottom part of the floor panel insert which will be in contact with the floor structure. (d) Install a new portion of the black foam shape (3 x 20 mm). (4) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of the fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations (Section 6) of the Maintenance Review Board Report (MRB). (5) Install the floor panel (2). WARNING: COR-BAN 27L IS TOXIC TO SKIN, EYES, AND RESPIRATORY TRACT. USE PVC GLOVES AND EYE PROTECTION. USE ONLY IN WELL VENTILATED AREAS. OBEY THE MANUFACTURER’S HEALTH AND SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS. (6) Install the screws (1) that attach the floor panel (2) to the passenger-cabin floor beams. The screws must be wet with COR-BAN 27L. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 53-01-02 Page 12 of 14 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (7) Tighten the screws (1). NOTE: Apply torque of 1.8 - 2.9 N.m (16 - 26 lbf.in). (8) Install the new white adhesive tapes. For aircraft with Airstairs Door, refer to (Figure 402). For aircraft with Side-Hinged Main Door, refer to (Figure 403). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-015-A (1) Install the Lavatory (AMM TASK 25-40-01-400-801-A/400) after the installation of floor panels 262CF and 261DF. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (2) Install the Toilet Partition ( AMM TASK 25-27-03-400-801-A/400) after the installation of floor panel 262CF. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (3) Install the Passenger-Cabin Floor Lining ( AMM TASK 25-24-01-400-801-A/400) after the installation of all passenger-cabin floor panels. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (4) Install the Floor Proximity Strip Lights (AMM TASK 33-50-12-400-801-A/400) after the installation of floor panels 231GF, 241BF, 241DF, 251DF, 251FF, and 251HF. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (5) Install the Passenger Seats (AMM TASK 25-21-01-400-801-A/400) after the installation of floor panels 241AF, 241EF, 251AF, 251JF, 251KF, 251EF, 251GF, 251JF, and 261CF on the LH side, 242AF, 242BF, 252AF, 252BF, 252CF, 252DF, and 262BF on the RH side, and, if applicable, 231EF and 231HF on the LH side. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (6) Install the Optional Flight Attendant Seat ( AMM TASK 25-21-02-400-801-A/400) after the installation of floor panel 262BF. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (7) Install the LH Wardrobe Option 2 (AMM TASK 25-26-04-400-804-A/400) after the installation of floor panels 231EF and 231HF, if applicable. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (8) Install the LH Wardrobe Option 1 (AMM TASK 25-26-04-400-803-A/400) after the installation of floor panel 231EF, if applicable. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (9) Install the LH Galley (AMM TASK 25-30-07-400-801-A/400) after the installation of floor panel 231EF, if applicable. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (10) For aircraft with Airstairs Door, install the Flight Attendant Seat ( AMM TASK 25-21-02-400-801-A/400) after the installation of floor panels 231CF and 231BF. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (11) For aircraft with Side-Hinged Main Door, install the Flight Attendant Seat ( AMM TASK 25-21-02-400-801-A/400) after the installation of floor panels 231JF and 231BF. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (12) Install the RH Wardrobe (AMM TASK 25-26-02-400-801-A/400) or the Outboard Galley Assembly ( AMM TASK 25-30-05-400-802-A/400), as applicable, after the installation of floor panel 232AF. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 53-01-02 Page 13 of 14 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (13) Install the Forward Galley (AMM TASK 25-30-01-400-804-A/400) after the installation of floor panel 232BF. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. (14) Install the RH Windscreen (AMM TASK 25-27-08-400-801-A/400) after the installation of floor panel 232CF. Refer to AMM MPP 06-41-02/100. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 53-01-02 Page 14 of 14 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
